answers.answer: You would be considered Pre-Diabetic. You should cut your carb intake get some walking in and by all means see your doctor. Trust me you don't want it to get any worse. So no you are not Diabetic but it would be one step over that line to get there. One really easy thing you can do is start eating High fiber foods, ( fiber only breaks down carbs if it is ingested together ). Also do not eat any white bread, the minute it goes in your mouth it changes to sugar. I hope this helps

Hypothyroidism may result in an increase in insulin resistance. Low magnesium is also another cause of increasing insulin (magnesium may be low with hypothyroidism).  Hypothyroidism also increases cholesterol so your doctor may have talked to you about taking a cholesterol lowering drug. However, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has just added new safety warnings to cholesterol reducing statin drugs - increased risk of type 2 diabetes and memory loss.Blood Glucose:From 70 to 99 mg/dL - Normal fasting glucoseFrom 100 to 125 mg/dL - Impaired fasting glucose (pre-diabetes)126 mg/dL and above on more than one testing occasion - Diabetes

Depending on who you talk with, normal blood sugar levels are close to 85-110 range. A1C I think should be under 3 or 4ish? A1C goes back 3 months. If it's at a 6 then I would assume yes, you have diabetic issues. Wouldn't hurt to go get checked out by a doc.

question: I  am 60 years old. My family history: Nobody is diabetic.  I am having hypoThyroidism problem.  I am over weight by 15 kgs.  I am taking thyronorm 50 mg.   Fasting  I checked  in 2-3 occasions  it is100, 110.  H1 Ac 6.1  .I wanted to know whether I am Diabetic or not.
title: Regarding diabetic
